actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Armed Services.

official_title: A bill to amend title 10 of the United States Code in order to eliminate or reduce certain deductible payments by patients for treatment under the uniformed services health benefits program, and to repeal the provision of law prohibiting CHAMPUS benefits to persons entitled to medicare benefits.

summary.text: Reduces specified deductible payments by patients for treatment under the uniformed services health benefits program. Repeals the provision of law prohibiting such benefits to persons entitled to medicare benefits. (Amends 10 U.S.C. 1079(b)(c), 1086(b)(c))

titles.title: A bill to amend title 10 of the United States Code in order to eliminate or reduce certain deductible payments by patients for treatment under the uniformed services health benefits program, and to repeal the provision of law prohibiting CHAMPUS benefits to persons entitled to medicare benefits.
